title: DIU selects nuclear-powered spacecraft designs for 2027 demonstrations
summary: The Defense Innovation Unit announced May 17 it selected Ultra Safe Nuclear Corp. and Avalanche to develop small nuclear-powered spacecraft for in-space demonstrations planned for 2027.

title: Satellites key to Canada’s Arctic surveillance strategy
summary: Citing a changing security climate, Canada is bolstering its defense and surveillance capabilities in the Arctic with a focus on using space assets and new technology.

title: Uzbekistan woos Starlink, OneWeb to bring satellite broadband
summary: The overtures to Starlink and OneWeb are part of the Uzbek government’s efforts to strengthen the Central Asian nation’s information technology competitiveness and provide better communications services to underserved remote areas.

title: SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket to launch record-breaking communications satellite
summary: A report on the latest in a long line of SpaceX launches significantly delayed by customer payload readiness has been updated to...

title: Space systems dominate Rocket Lab revenue
summary: Rocket Lab, the company best known for its Electron small launch vehicle, generated most of its first quarter revenue from other space systems and not launch itself.

title: ABL Space Systems completes acceptance testing of RS1 upper stage
summary: ABL Space Systems has completed testing of the second stage of its small launch vehicle, four months after a previous version of the stage was destroyed in a test accident.

title: NASA, Air Liquide continue working on Artemis 1 WDR issues
summary: NASA’s Artemis 1 flight vehicle remains in the Vehicle Assembly Building (VAB) at the Kennedy Space Center (KSC) in Florida while work to investigate and fix problems found in April at the launch pad continues. A series of issues were discovered during three attempts to perform the Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) while the Orion spacecraft and Space Launch System (SLS) rocket were out at Launch Pad 39B.

title: Spacecom plots maritime expansion after netting first customer
summary: Israeli satellite operator Spacecom is adjusting its business to serve maritime customers as the market shows signs of recovering from the pandemic.

title: India hit by more suspected space debris
summary: Indian authorities are examining several pieces of suspected space debris that fell into rural western India on May 12, with the timing of the incident suggesting they could be parts of a Chinese rocket that reentered the atmosphere that day.

title: U.S. Space Force sees future demand for surveillance beyond Earth orbit
summary: Space Force Lt. Gen. Whiting said the U.S. military will likely have to pay more attention to what’s happening in cislunar space
